column1: 我二十一岁时，正在云南插队。
column2: At twenty-one, I was placed in a production team for reeducation in Yunnan.

column1: 陈清扬当时二十六岁，就在我插队的地方当医生。
column2: That year Chen Qingyang was twenty-six and a doctor who happened to work where I did.

column1: 我在山下十四队，她在山上十五队。
column2: I was on the fourteenth production team down the mountain, and she was on the fifteenth team up the mountain.

column1: 有一天她从山上下来，和我讨论她不是破鞋的问题。
column2: One day she came down the mountain to see me, to discuss the fact that she was not damaged goods.

column1: 那时我还不大认识她，只能说有一点知道。
column2: I didn't know her too well at the time, barely you might say.

column1: 她要讨论的事是这祥的：虽然所有的人都说她是一个破鞋，但她以为自己不是的。
column2: The issue she wanted to discuss was this: Despite the fact that everyone believed she was damaged goods, she didn't think she was.

column1: 因为破鞋偷汉，而她没有偷过汉。
column2: Because, to be damaged goods she had to have cheated on her husband, but she never did.

column1: 虽然她丈夫已经住了一年监狱，但她没有偷过汉。 在此之前也未偷过汉。
column2: Although her husband had been in prison for a year, she hadn't slept with another man, nor had she ever done anything like that.

column1: 所以她简直不明白，人们为什么要说她是破鞋。
column2: Therefore she simply couldn't understand why people kept calling her damaged goods.

column1: 如果我要安慰她，并不困难。 我可以从逻辑上证明她不是破鞋。
column2: If I'd wanted to comfort her, it wouldn't have been hard; I could prove logically that she was not damaged goods.

column1: 如果陈清扬是破鞋，即陈清扬偷汉，则起码有一个某人为其所偷。
column2: If Chen Qingyang were damaged goods, she would have had to have cheated on her husband, and therefore, there must be a man with whom she'd cheated.

column1: 如今不能指出某人，所以陈清扬偷汉不能成立。
column2: Since at present no one could point out such a man, the proposition that Chen Qingyang had slept with another man was untenable.

column1: 但是我偏说，陈清扬就是破鞋，而且这一点毋庸置疑。
column2: Yet I insisted on saying that Chen Qingyang was damaged goods, and that this was beyond question.

column1: 陈清扬找我证明她不是破鞋，起因是我找她打针。
column2: Chen Qingyang came to me to ask me to prove she wasn't damaged goods because I had come to her for a shot.

column1: 这事经过如下：农忙时队长不叫我犁田，而是叫我去插秧，这样我的腰就不能经常直立。
column2: The whole thing unfolded as follows: During the farm's busy season our team leader would not assign me to plow fields. Instead he made me plant rice seedlings so that I could not stand straight most of the time.

column1: 认识我的人都知道，我的腰上有旧伤，而且我身高在一米九以上。
column2: Anyone familiar with me knew about the injury to my lower back, not to mention that I was a tall man, over six feet.

column1: 如此插了一个月，我腰痛难忍，不打封闭就不能入睡。
column2: Having worked like this for a month, the pain in my lower back became so intolerable that I couldn't fall asleep without steroid injections.

column1: 我们队医务室那一把针头镀层剥落，而且都有倒钩，经常把我腰上的肉钩下来。
column2: The clinic at our team had a bunch of needles whose coating had completely peeled off, with tips all bent like fishhooks, which often pulled flesh from my lower back.

column1: 后来我的腰就像中了散弹枪，伤痕久久不褪。
column2: After a while my waist looked like it had been peppered by a shotgun, and the scars didn't fade for a long time.

column1: 就在这种情况下，我想起十五队的队医陈清扬是北医大毕业的大夫，对针头和勾针大概还能分清，所以我去找她看病。
column2: Under the circumstances, I recalled that the doctor at the fifteenth team, Chen Qingyang, had graduated from Beijing Medical School. Maybe she would be able to tell the difference between a hypodermic and a crotchet needle. So I went to see her.

column1: 看完病回来，不到半个小时，她就追到我屋里来，要我证明她不是破鞋。
column2: Not half an hour after my visit, she chased after me to my room, wanting me to prove that she wasn't damaged goods.

column1: 陈清扬说，她丝毫也不藐视破鞋。
column2: Chen Qingyang said she didn't look down on damaged goods at all.

column1: 据她观察，破鞋都很善良，乐于助人，而且最不乐意让人失望。
column2: In fact, from what she observed, damaged goods seemed to have soft hearts, loved to help others and, most of all, hated to disappoint people.

column1: 因此她对破鞋还有一点钦佩。
column2: Therefore, she even had a sneaking admiration for people like them.

column1: 问题不在于破鞋好不好，而在于她根本不是破鞋。 就如一只猫不是一只狗一样。
column2: However, the problem was not whether damaged goods were good or not good, but lay in the fact that she was not damaged goods at all, just as a cat was not a dog.

column1: 假如一只猫被人叫成一只狗，它也会感到很不自在。
column2: If a cat were called a dog, it wouldn't feel comfortable.

column1: 现在大家都管她叫破鞋，弄得她魂不守舍，几乎连自己是谁都不知道了。
column2: Now everyone called her damaged goods, which drove her to distraction and made her almost forget who she was.

column1: 陈清扬在我的草房里时，裸臂赤腿穿一件白大褂，和她在山上那间医务室里装束一样。
column2: As Chen Qingyang sat in my thatched shack and poured out her troubles, she had on a white smock that left her arms and legs exposed, the same outfit she had worn earlier in her clinic.

column1: 所不同的是披散的长发用个手绢束住，脚上也多了一双拖鞋。
column2: The only differences were that she had tied back her long, loose hair with a handkerchief and put on a pair of sandals.

column1: 看了她的样子，我就开始捉摸：她那件白大褂底下是穿了点什么呢，还是什么都没穿。 这一点可以说明陈清扬很漂亮，因为她觉得穿什么不穿什么无所谓。
column2: As I looked at her, I began to wonder what was under her white smock, whether she had something on—or nothing at all, which would show what a beautiful woman Chen Qingyang was because she believed that it didn't really matter whether or not she wore underwear.

column1: 这是从小培养起来的自信心。
column2: That kind of confidence needs to have been built up from childhood.

column1: 我对她说，她确实是个破鞋。 还举出一些理由来：所谓破鞋者，乃是一个指称，大家都说你是破鞋，你就是破鞋，没什么道理可讲。 大家说你偷了汉，你就是偷了汉，这也没什么道理可讲。
column2: I told her that she was definitely damaged goods, and even enumerated several reasons to convince her. I said that so-called damaged goods was just a denotation. If people say you're damaged goods, then you must be damaged goods—there isn't much logic to it; if people say you slept with another man, you must have done it—there is not much logic to that either.

column1: 至于大家为什么要说你是破鞋，照我看是这样：大家都认为，结了婚的女人不偷汉，就该面色黝黑，乳房下垂。
column2: As for why they say you're damaged goods, in my opinion it's because of this: People generally agree that if a married woman hasn't cheated on her husband, her face must be leathery, and her breasts must sag.

column1: 而你脸不黑而且白，乳房不下垂而且高耸，所以你是破鞋。
column2: Now your face is not dark but fair, your breasts are not hanging down but jutting out, so you must be damaged goods.

column1: 假如你不想当破鞋，就要把脸弄黑，把乳房弄下垂，以后别人就不说你是破鞋。 当然这样很吃亏，假如你不想吃亏，就该去偷个汉来。 这样你自己也认为自己是个破鞋。
column2: If you don't want to be damaged goods, you should try to darken your face and make your breasts sag so people won't accuse you of being damaged goods, which, of course, is a raw deal for you. If you don't want a raw deal, sleep with another man so you can think of yourself as damaged goods, too.

column1: 别人没有义务先弄明白你是否偷汉再决定是否管你叫破鞋。 你倒有义务叫别人无法叫你破鞋。
column2: Other people are not obliged to find out if you are damaged goods before calling you that, but you are obliged to stop them from calling you damaged goods.

column1: 陈清扬听了这话，脸色发红，怒目圆睁，几乎就要打我一耳光。
column2: As Chen Qingyang listened to my words, her face flushed and her eyes widened with anger. She looked like she was about to slap me.

column1: 这女人打人耳光出了名，好多人吃过她的耳光。
column2: This woman was famous for her slapping; many men had felt her slaps.

column1: 但是她忽然泄了气，说：好吧，破鞋就破鞋吧。
column2: However, suddenly disheartened, she said, "All right, let me be damaged goods.

column1: 但是垂不垂黑不黑的，不是你的事。
column2: As far as drooping or not drooping, dark or not dark, that's none of your business."

column1: 她还说，假如我在这些事上琢磨得太多，很可能会吃耳光。
column2: She also said that if I spent too much time pondering these matters, I would very likely get slapped.

column1: 倒退到二十年前，想像我和陈清扬讨论破鞋问题时的情景。
column2: Imagine the scene twenty years ago, when Chen Qingyang and I discussed the damaged goods issue.

column1: 那时我面色焦黄，嘴唇干裂，上面沾了碎纸和烟丝，头发乱如败棕，身穿一件破军衣，上面好多破洞都是橡皮膏粘上的，跷着二郎腿，坐在木板床上，完全是一副流氓相。
column2: Back then, my face was baked brown, my lips were dry and chapped, with bits of paper and tobacco stuck to them, my hair was matted like a coconut husk, the many holes in the ragged army greatcoat I wore were patched with bandages, as I sat, legs crossed, on the wooden bed, looking like a total hooligan.

column1: 你可以想像陈清扬听到这么个人说起她的乳房下垂不下垂时，手心是何等的发痒。
column2: You can imagine when Chen Qingyang heard such a person talking about whether her breasts drooped or not, how the palm of her hand itched.

column1: 她有点神经质，都是因为有很多精壮的男人找她看病，其实却没有病。
column2: She was a little oversensitive, but that was because many strong men went to see her who weren't sick at all.

column1: 那些人其实不是去看大夫，而是去看破鞋。
column2: What they wanted to see was damaged goods, not a doctor.

column1: 只有我例外。
column2: I was the only exception.

column1: 我的后腰上好像被猪八戒筑了两耙。
column2: My lower back looked like it had been struck by Pigsy's rake.

column1: 不管腰疼真不真，光那些窟窿也能成为看医生的理由。
column2: Whether my back really hurt or not, those holes alone would justify my visit to the doctor.

column1: 这些窟窿使她产生一个希望，就是也许能向我证明，她不是破鞋。
column2: Those holes also made her hope she might be able to convince me she was not damaged goods.

column1: 有一个人承认她不是破鞋，和没人承认大不一样。
column2: Even if there were just one person who believed she wasn't damaged goods, it would be very different than no one believing her.

column1: 可是我偏让她失望。
column2: But I intentionally disappointed her.

column1: 我是这么想的：假如我想证明她不是破鞋，就能证明她不是破鞋，那事情未免太容易了。
column2: This is what I thought: if I wanted to prove she was not damaged goods and I could, then things would be too easy.

column1: 实际上我什么都不能证明，除了那些不需证明的东西。
column2: The truth was I couldn't prove anything, except things that didn't need proving.

column1: 春天里，队长说我打瞎了他家母狗的左眼，使它老是偏过头来看人，好像在跳芭蕾舞。
column2: In spring, our team leader claimed I was the one who had shot out the left eye of his dog, which was why the dog always looked at people with its head tilted, as if she were dancing ballet.

column1: 从此后他总给我小鞋穿。
column2: From then on, he always gave me a hard time.

column1: 我想证明我自己的清白无辜，只有以下三个途径：1、队长家不存在一只母狗；2、该母狗天生没有左眼；3、我是无手之人，不能持枪射击。
column2: Three things could have proved my innocence: 1. The team leader had no dog; 2. The dog was born blind in the left eye; 3. I'm a man with no hands who can't aim a gun.

column1: 结果是三条一条也不成立。 队长家确有一棕色母狗，该母狗的左眼确是后天打瞎，而我不但能持枪射击，而且枪法极精。
column2: Finally, none of the three requirements could be established: the team leader did have a brown dog; her left eye was indeed blinded by a shot; I could not only aim a gun but was also was an excellent marksman.

column1: 在此之前不久，我还借了罗小四的汽枪，用一碗绿豆做子弹，在空粮库里打下了二斤耗子。
column2: To make matters worse, I'd borrowed an air rifle from Luo Xiaosi not long before the incident, and using a bowl of mung beans as bullets, killed a couple of pounds of mice in an empty granary.

column1: 当然，这队里枪法好的人还有不少，其中包括罗小四。
column2: Of course, there were other crack shots on our production team, and one of them was Luo Xiaosi.

column1: 汽枪就是他的，而且他打瞎队长的母狗时，我就在一边看着。
column2: When he fired at the team leader's dog, I stood right beside him watching.

column1: 但是我不能揭发别人，罗小四和我也不错。
column2: But I couldn't inform on other people, and my relationship with Luo Xiaosi was not bad.

column1: 何况队长要是能惹得起罗小四，也不会认准了是我。
column2: Besides, if the team leader could have handled Luo Xiaosi, he wouldn't have accused me.

column1: 所以我保持沉默。
column2: So I kept quiet.

column1: 沉默就是默认。
column2: To keep silent meant to acquiesce.

column1: 所以春天我去插秧，撅在地里像一根半截电线杆，秋收后我又去放牛，吃不上热饭。
column2: That was why in the spring I had to plant rice seedlings, stooped over in the field like a broken electricity pole; in the autumn I had to herd cattle, so I couldn't get a hot meal.

column1: 当然，我也不肯无所作为。
column2: Of course, I could not take this lying down.

column1: 有一天在山上，我正好借了罗小四的汽枪，队长家的母狗正好跑到山上叫我看见，我就射出一颗子弹打瞎了它的右眼。
column2: One day as I walked on the mountain, the team leader's dog came into view. I happened to have Luo Xiaosi's air rifle with me, so I fired a bullet and blinded her right eye.

column1: 该狗既无左眼，又无右眼，也就不能跑回去让队长看见——天知道它跑到哪儿去了。
column2: With neither left eye nor right eye, the dog couldn't get back to the team leader's house—God knows where she went.

column1: 我记得那些日子里，除了上山放牛和在家里躺着，似乎什么也没做。 我觉得什么都与我无关。
column2: I remember in those days, besides herding cattle on the mountain and lying in bed, I didn't have anything to do and nothing seemed to matter.

column1: 可是陈清扬又从山上跑下来找我。
column2: But Chen Qingyang came down the mountain again to see me.

column1: 原来又有了另一种传闻，说她在和我搞破鞋。 她要我给出我们清白无辜的证明。
column2: There was another rumor in the air that she was having an affair with me and this time she wanted me to prove our innocence.

column1: 我说，要证明我们无辜，只有证明以下两点：1、陈清扬是处女；2、我是天阉之人，没有性交能力。
column2: I told her that we would have to prove two things first before our innocence could be established: 1. Chen Qingyang was a virgin; 2. Castrated at birth, I was unable to have sex.

column1: 这两点都难以证明。 所以我们不能证明自己无辜。
column2: These two things would be hard to prove, so we couldn't prove our innocence.

column1: 我倒倾向于证明自己不无辜。
column2: I preferred to prove our guilt.

column1: 陈清扬听了这些话，先是气得脸白，然后满面通红，最后一声不吭地站起来走了。
column2: On hearing my words, Chen Qingyang's face first turned pale and then blushed all over. Finally she stood up and left without saying a word.

column1: 陈清扬说，我始终是一个恶棍。
column2: Chen Qingyang told me later that I had always been a scoundrel.

column1: 她第一次要我证明她清白无辜时，我翻了一串白眼，然后开始胡说八道。 第二次她要我证明我们俩无辜，我又一本正经地向她建议举行一次性交。
column2: The first time she wanted me to prove her innocence, I looked up at the ceiling and began to talk nonsense; the next time she wanted me to prove our innocence, I earnestly suggested having intercourse with her.

column1: 所以她就决定，早晚要打我一个耳光。
column2: So she decided she was going to slap me sooner or later.

column1: 假如我知道她有这样的打算，也许后面的事情就不会发生。
column2: If I had guessed her plan at the time, the things that happened later might never have happened.

column1: 我过二十一岁生日那天，正在河边放牛。
column2: On my twenty-first birthday, I was herding buffalo at the riverside.

column1: 下午我躺在草地上睡着了。
column2: In the afternoon I fell asleep on the grass.

column1: 我睡去时，身上盖了几片芭蕉叶子，醒来时身上已经一无所有（叶子可能被牛吃了）。
column2: I remembered covering myself with a few banana leaves before I fell asleep, but by the time I woke up I found nothing on my body. (Perhaps the buffalo had eaten the leaves.)

column1: 亚热带旱季的阳光把我晒得浑身赤红，痛痒难当，我的小和尚直翘翘地指向天空，尺寸空前。
column2: The sunshine in the subtropical dry season had burned my entire body red, leaving me in an agony of burning and itching. My little Buddha pointed to the sky like an arrow, bigger than ever.

column1: 这就是我过生日时的情形。
column2: That was how I spent my birthday.

column1: 我醒来时觉得阳光耀眼，天蓝得吓人，身上落了一层细细的尘土，好像一层爽身粉。
column2: When I woke up, the sun glared down on me from a frighteningly blue sky. A layer of fine dust, like a coating of talcum powder, covered my whole body.

column1: 我一生经历的无数次勃起，都不及那一次雄浑有力，大概是因为在极荒僻的地方，四野无人。
column2: I'd experienced numerous erections in my life, but none as vigorous and magnificent as that time. Perhaps it was because of the location, so isolated from the villages that not even a soul could be seen.

column1: 我爬起来看牛，发现它们都卧在远处的河岔里静静地嚼草。
column2: I got up to check on my buffalo, only to find them all crouching at the far fork of the rivers, chewing grass quietly.

column1: 那时节万籁无声，田野上刮着白色的风。
column2: It was a surpassingly still moment, and the white wind was gently blowing across the field.

column1: 河岸上有几对寨子里的牛在斗架，斗得眼珠通红，口角流涎。
column2: On the bank, several pairs of bulls from the mountain village were fighting each other. Their eyes had turned red, and saliva drooled from the corner of their mouths.

column1: 这种牛阴囊紧缩，阳具挺直。
column2: This sort of bull had tightly packed balls and protruding penises.

column1: 我们的牛不干这种事。
column2: Our bulls were not like that.

column1: 任凭别人上门挑衅，我们的牛依旧安卧不动。
column2: They would lie on the ground and stay put no matter how hard the other bulls tried to provoke them.

column1: 为了防止斗架伤身，影响春耕，我们把它们都阉了。
column2: To prevent our bulls from hurting each other and slowing down the spring plowing, we castrated all of them.

column1: 每次阉牛我都在场。
column2: I was present every time they castrated the bulls.

column1: 对于一般的公牛，只用刀割去即可。
column2: Ordinary bulls could just be cut with a knife.

column1: 但是对于格外生性者，就须采取锤骟术，也就是割开阴囊，掏出睾九，一木锤砸个稀烂。
column2: But for extremely wild ones, you have to employ the art of hammer-smashing, which is to cut open their scrotums, take out the balls, and then use a wooden hammer to pulverize them.

column1: 从此后受术者只知道吃草干活，别的什么都不知道，连杀都不用捆。
column2: From then on these altered bulls knew nothing but grazing and working. No need to tie them down if you wanted to kill them.

column1: 掌锤的队长毫不怀疑这种手术施之于人类也能得到同等的效力，每回他都对我们呐喊：你们这些生牛蛋子，就欠砸上一锤才能老实！
column2: Our team leader, the one who always wielded the hammer, had no doubts that surgery of this kind would also work on humans. He would shout at us all the time: You young bulls! You need a good hammering to make you behave.

column1: 按他的逻辑，我身上这个通红通红，直不愣登，长约一尺的东西就是罪恶的化身。
column2: In his way of thinking, this red, stiff, foot-long thing on my body was the incarnation of evil.

column1: 当然，我对此有不同的意见。
column2: Of course, I had a different opinion.

column1: 在我看来，这东西无比重要，就如我之存在本身。
column2: To me, the thing was extremely important, as important as my existence itself.

column1: 天色微微向晚，天上飘着懒洋洋的云彩。
column2: The darkness began to settle in, and a cloud drifted idly across the sky.

column1: 下半截沉在黑暗里，上半截仍浮在阳光中。
